description._content: O'Sullivan, Timothy H., 1840-1882, photographer. Shoshone Cañon, Idaho [1868] 1 photographic print : albumen. Notes: Photograph shows cliffs along the Shoshone Canyon looking up the Snake River from a point to the left of the Shoshone Falls. Title from item. Plate 141 from: Geological exploration of the fortieth parallel : Photographs / U.S. Army Corps. of Engineers ; Clarence King, geologist in charge. [Washington, D.C., 187-]. Published in: Framing the West: The Survey Photographs of Timothy H. O'Sullivan / Toby Jurovics, Carol M. Johnson, Glenn Willumson, and William F. Stapp. New Haven: Yale University Press, 2010, plate 29. Subjects: United States Geological Exploration of the Fortieth Parallel--(1867-1881) Canyons--Idaho--1860-1870. Cliffs--Idaho--1860-1870. Rivers--Idaho--1860-1870. Snake River (Wyo.-Wash.)--1860-1870. Format: Expedition photographs--1860-1870. Albumen prints--1860-1870. Rights Info: No known restrictions on publication. Repository: Library of Congress, Prints and Photographs Division, Washington, D.C. 20540 USA, hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/pp.print Persistent URL: hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/ppmsca.11930 Call Number: LOT 7096, no. 144
